title: 9-year-old dies after accidentally shooting himself
content:
A 9-year-old has died at a local hospital after police say he accidentally shot himself in the head while playing with a gun. (MGN photo)
LITTLE ROCK (KATV) — A 9-year-old boy has died at a local hospital after police say he accidentally shot himself in the head while playing with a gun.
Police responded to a home on Romine Road Wednesday afternoon and found the little boy in the living room suffering from a gunshot wound. An unknown caliber black handgun was laying on his chest.
The boy was treated at the scene and transported to Arkansas Children's Hospital in critical condition.
The boy was pronounced dead a few hours later.
His 11-year-old brother told police they were home alone and the victim got the handgun out and began playing with it. He said the gun then accidentally discharged, with a single bullet striking the boy in the forehead.
The older brother ran to a neighbor's house and called police for help.
Police are investigating the incident and have not released the name of the victim.
For information on how to talk to your children about gun safety, you can log onto the NRA's Eddie Eagle Gunsafe Program or Project Child Safe.
